title: Shustoke Reservoir Walking Route

images.title: Jeremy Bolwell / Shustoke Reservoir
images.caption: Shustoke Reservoir. On a sunny, blowy Sunday the sailing club is busy and a flock of Canada geese and a few pairs of swans are also out on the water.

images.title: Angella Streluk / Shustoke reservoir
images.caption: The east end of the reservoir. Nearby is a bridge which crosses the river and the railway.

images.title: Richard Harrison / Shustoke village
images.caption: Shustoke village, a pub and a cycle repair shop...what more do you need?

images.title: Angella Streluk / Shustoke reservoir
images.caption: The western end on a fine summer day.

images.title: Spring Flowers in Shustoke by John A Lainchbury, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Spring Flowers in Shustoke village. Pretty daffodil display at the western end of the reservoir in March. A picnic site can be found in this area.

images.title: John A Lainchbury / Spring is here
images.caption: Spring is here. Snowdrops in a woodland area just to the south west of the site off Castle Lane. Photo taken in mid February.

description: Enjoy an easy circular walk around this pretty reservoir in Coleshill, Warwickshire. A good footpath runs around the perimeter of the water, with woodland and wildfowers around the water's edge. The River Bourne also runs through the site. You can start your outing from the public car park at the south western end of the water, close to Shustoke village. The Heart of England Way and the Warwickshire Centenary Way both pass the reservoir so you could pick up one of these long distance trails to extend your walk.  Cyclists can reach the reservoir on the North Warwickshire Cycle Way.
